author: Imran Gowhar
text:
The Southeast division police arrested the founder-chancellor of a private university in Bengaluru on Saturday on the charge of raping his 32-year-old niece between 2011 and 2014. She was in her late 20s at that time, and was working at her uncle’s university, where she held an administrative position.

The accused, who has a doctorate from an international university, is a noted academic and also a recent recipient of a prestigious award. He has been booked under Section 376 of the IPC and remanded in judicial custody.

The accused was picked up from his residence in J.P. Nagar on Saturday, based on a complaint filed by the mother of the victim. In her report to the police, the mother has alleged that the chancellor raped her daughter between 2011 and 2014, because of which she went into depression. In her complaint, she said that her daughter resigned from her job in 2015 due to this act. Her depression was so debilitating that she was admitted to a city hospital this January.

That is when the incident came to light. During the course of the treatment, she narrated the ordeal which no one in her family had known about.

The accused has claimed that the charges are false and said that the family was currently in the middle of a property row. Two cases related to property dispute filed in the Anekal police station are pending trial.

The accused, who founded the university, has several properties worth crores of rupees and had nominated his siblings as caretakers. The mother of the victim (the chancellor’s sister) and her husband are one of the nominees.

Victim was working in an administrative position in her uncle’s university

in Bengaluru
title: Chancellor of Bengaluru private varsity arrested on rape charge
